net.jxta.impl.peergroup
Class CompatibilityUtils

java.lang.Object
  net.jxta.impl.peergroup.CompatibilityUtils

public final class CompatibilityUtils
extends Object

General compatibility utility library for centralizing default compatibility information. This class should not be used by applications. It is merely a centralized location for the implementation classes to use. There are other, supported ways of accessing this information for application use.

Method Summary

          Create a default module compatibility statement.

Method Detail

getDefaultPackageURI

@Deprecated
public static String getDefaultPackageURI()
Deprecated. will be removed in 2.8

This method exists only to support the deprecated StdPeerGroup MODULE_IMPL_STD_URI field. Do not use.

Returns:
default module impl package URI

getDefaultProvider

@Deprecated
public static String getDefaultProvider()
Deprecated. will be removed in 2.8

This method exists only to support the deprecated StdPeerGroup MODULE_IMPL_STD_PROVIDER field. Do not use.

Returns:
default module impl provider

createModuleImplAdvertisement

public static ModuleImplAdvertisement createModuleImplAdvertisement(ModuleSpecID msid,
                                                                    String className,
                                                                    String description)
Given all the required information, constructs and returns a simple ModuleImplAdvertisement. This is a bit of an odd duck for being in this library, but it makes sense if you think about it as constructing a default, compatible, implementation advertisement.

Parameters:
msid - ModuleSpecID of the Module
className - Class name of the Module implementation
description - description of the Module
Returns:
ModuleImplAdvertisement

createDefaultCompatStatement

public static XMLDocument createDefaultCompatStatement()
Create a default module compatibility statement. This method should not be used by applications to obtain a compatibility statement. The supported way for an application to create a compatibility statement is to obtain a default PeerGroup implementation advertisement and extract it's compatibility statement.

Returns:
compatibility statement document

isCompatible

public static boolean isCompatible(Element compat)
Evaluates if the given compatibility statement makes the module that bears it is loadable by this group.

Parameters:
compat - The compatibility statement being tested.
Returns:
true if we are compatible with the provided statement otherwise false.
